LONDON: Intensive farming techniques have led to a common antibiotic-resistant pathogen to become capable of infecting both cattle and humans, according to a study which suggests the need to check agriculture practices for such outbreaks.

articles.author: Madeleine Aggeler
articles.title: How Do I Stay Sober Now? - The Cut
articles.description: It was two weeks into social distancing that I started craving alcohol again.
articles.content: By the time I was eight months sober, the version of myself who drank felt like a distant memory. Id think back on her with pity, and a little condescension. Why did I think I needed alcohol to have fun? Id wonder, knowing full well that fun had nothing to do… [+6139 chars]

articles.title: Nursing cancer patients during COVID-19 - NEWS CENTER Maine
articles.description: Nurses at Northern Light Cancer Care are dealing with physical and emotional changes during the coronavirus pandemic to better protect susceptible patients.
